name: Jaggy Thistle Napkins
description:
The iconic Scottish Thistle. 

Set of 4 Napkins 100% Cotton. 

Natural or White Cotton, with Dusty Thistle Pink and Pine Needle Green coloured threads depicting one big, jaggy, Scottish thistle.  

We use free motion embroidery, in essence drawing with the sewing machine to apply our own unique designs - no digitisation here...we freehand stitch the design using a standard (but rather smashing) sewing machine.

Due to our freehand technique, as in nature, no two thistles are exactly the same!

Napkin size 45cm x 45cm (approx)

name: Tweed Christmas Cards x 6
description:
Using our stock of Scottish tweeds, and a dash of digital wizardry we have created a technicolor forest of tweed tree Christmas cards.

Please note:
No tweed was harmed in the making of these cards!

Designed by Juniper & Jane and printed here in Scotland.


Card Size A6 - Blank inside for your own message
White envelopes included.

name: Harris Tweed Clock Green Herringbone
description:
Juniper & Jane's original clock design in a vibrant green herringbone Harris Tweed.  

The wooden frame with brass fitment is actually an embroidery hoop which has been lovingly stained by hand to give a Georgian Oak appearance.  The golden metal clock hands look elegant against the sumptuous wool.

This clock has been crafted by hand in our wee textiles studio, and showcases that most iconic of handwoven fabrics, Harris Tweed.  The woven label, stitched proudly on the clock face, guarantees the authenticity of the fabric as protected by a 1993 Act of Parliament.  For more information on Harris Tweed click on the Orb at the foot of the page.

As with most of our products, Harris Tweed is inspired by the majestic natural landscapes of Scotland.

Size = 8" diameter

name: Jaggy Thistle Tea Towel
description:
The iconic Scottish Thistle. 

100% Cotton Tea Towel. 

Natural or White Cotton, with Dusty Thistle Pink and Pine Needle Green coloured threads depicting two big, jaggy, Scottish thistles.  

We use free motion embroidery, in essence drawing with the sewing machine to apply our own unique designs - no digitisation here...we freehand stitch the design using a standard (but rather smashing) sewing machine.

Due to our freehand technique, as in nature, no two thistles are exactly the same!

Tea Towel size 78cm x 48cm (approx)

name: Schiehallion Tea Towel
description:
One of Scotland's most iconic peaks, Schiehallion.

Did you know that, In 1774, due largely to it’s regular conical shape, Schiehallion was used in an experiment to calculate the density of the Earth? During this experiment Charles Hutton developed the notion of contour lines.

The eastern part of Schiehallion as well as the quieter and wilder Gleann Mòr to the south is owned by the John Muir Trust.  The John Muir Trust is the leading wild land conservation charity in the UK and is committed to protecting and improving wild places for people and wildlife.

For each Schiehallion product sold a donation of £1.00 will be gifted to the John Muir Trust to help with their conservation work on the mountain.
 
As John Muir himself said, "Do something for wildness and make the mountains glad"


100% Cotton Tea Towel.  Natural or White Cotton and a choice of four natural Scottish colours:  Highland Mist Grey, Dusty Thistle Pink, Lochan Blue or Pine Needle Green.

The ideal gift or souvenir for those who love hiking, hillwalking, munro-bagging, climbing, rambling or simply admiring the Scottish mountains.

We use free motion embroidery, in essence drawing with the sewing machine to apply our designs - no digitisation here...we freehand stitch the design using a standard (but rather smashing) sewing machine.

Tea Towel size 78cm x 48cm (approx)

Summit fae Scotland!

name: Ben Lomond Apron
description:
One of Scotland's most iconic peaks, Ben Lomond. 

The most Southerly of the Munro’s, rises from the east shore of Loch Lomond.  There is a well trodden tourist path, or the more challenging Ptarmigan route for the energetic hillwalker with even more spectacular views (assuming the clag doesn't set in!).

100% Cotton Adult Apron. Dimensions 87cm (h) x 58cm (w) and 58cm web straps (approx) in Natural or White Cotton and a choice of four natural Scottish colours: Highland Mist Grey, Dusty Thistle Pink, Lochan Blue or Pine Needle Green.

The ideal gift or souvenir for those who love hiking, hillwalking, munro-bagging, climbing, rambling or simply admiring the Scottish mountains.

We use free motion embroidery, in essence drawing with the sewing machine to apply our designs - no digitisation here...we freehand stitch the design using a standard (but rather smashing) sewing machine.

Summit fae Scotland!

name: Arran Tea Towel
description:
The Isle of Arran is located in the Firth of Clyde off the coast of Ayrshire and is 20 miles long by 10 miles across. 
The island has often been called a geologists paradise. It has an unrivalled variety of geology for such a small area. Our own Juniper spent a week conducting fieldwork there, measuring and interpreting igneous intrusions, aeolian sandstone boundaries, a multitude of fossils and the famous Hutton’s Unconformity. In 1787 James Hutton  identified structures near Lochranza which lead to him concluding that the Earth was much older than people had previously thought.

For each Arran product sold through our website, we donate £1.00 to the Arran Trust. The Trust raise funds to look after the beautiful landscapes and environment of The Isle of Arran.

100% Cotton Tea Towel.  Natural or White Cotton and a choice of four natural Scottish colours:  Highland Mist Grey, Dusty Thistle Pink, Lochan Blue or Pine Needle Green.

We use free motion embroidery, in essence drawing with the sewing machine to apply our designs - no digitisation here...we freehand stitch the design using a standard (but rather smashing) sewing machine.

Tea Towel size 78cm x 48cm (approx)

name: Cairngorm Tea Towel
description:
One of Scotland's most iconic peaks, Cairngorm.

The Funicular Mountain Railway on Cairngorm Mountain is the highest railway journey in the UK and goes to just below the summit of the mountain itself, in just eight minutes.

100% Cotton Tea Towel.  Natural or White Cotton and a choice of four natural Scottish colours:  Highland Mist Grey, Dusty Thistle Pink, Lochan Blue or Pine Needle Green.

The ideal gift or souvenir for those who love hiking, hillwalking, munro-bagging, climbing, rambling or simply admiring the Scottish mountains.

name: Ben Arthur Tea Towel
description:
One of Scotland's most iconic peaks, Ben Arthur.

Ben Arthur, or "The Cobbler", features a large rocky summit. To reach the true and highest point a climber would need to complete a risky manoeuvre called ‘threading the needle’. 

100% Cotton Tea Towel.  Natural or White Cotton and a choice of four natural Scottish colours:  Highland Mist Grey, Dusty Thistle Pink, Lochan Blue or Pine Needle Green.

The ideal gift or souvenir for those who love hiking, hillwalking, munro-bagging, climbing, rambling or simply admiring the Scottish mountains.

name: Outer Hebrides Tea Towel
description:
Alba’s 125 mile long chain of islands on the edge of the Atlantic Ocean.  Formed, largely, from some of Europe’s most ancient rocks, the Lewisian Gneisses. These remote landscapes have been sculpted by wind, rain, ice and the relentless pounding of the wild Atlantic waves, creating awe-inspiring scenery which varies dramatically from the peaty uplands of Lewis to the igneous sills of Shiant Isles to the rare pale grey Anorthositic peaks of South Harris.

100% Cotton Tea Towel. Natural or White Cotton and a choice of four natural Scottish colours: Highland Mist Grey, Dusty Thistle Pink, Lochan Blue or Pine Needle Green.

We use free motion embroidery, in essence drawing with the sewing machine to apply our designs - no digitisation here...we freehand stitch the design using a standard (but rather smashing) sewing machine.

Click on our blog to read about our Trip to the Edge, with some stunning photo's of the island of Lewis & Harris.

Tea Towel size 78cm x 48cm (approx)
